results.title: Parents and children
results.creator_credit: Dick Foster and Eurfron Gwynne Jones
results.brief_description: The understanding and role of children in different societies, eg education system and valued roles. Highlighting various children in an education environment and the role of the educational bodies in diverse political systems. For example: collective education and education for the individual

results.title: Parenting: stress and the child
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: Looks at some potentially stressful family situations for the child, such as the arrival of a baby, entry into a new school, and puberty. Indicates that, although stress is inevitable in children’s lives, once the causes are realised by parents, it can be utilised as a stepping stone towards emotional growth and family unity.

results.title: Parental behaviour of fish
results.creator_credit: University of Melbourne, Michael Sullivan and Cheryl Houben
results.brief_description: Shows patterns of breeding and parental care in ciclid fish and encourages the use of aquaria in animal behaviour studies in schools. The first part compares the behaviour of two central American species; the second part presents the strikingly different parental care of an African ciclid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of Melbourne, Michael Sullivan and Cheryl Houben
results.description: Shows patterns of breeding and parental care in ciclid fish and encourages the use of aquaria in animal behaviour studies in schools. results.title: Parent teacher interviews
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, South Australia. Dept. of Education, John Morris and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Five encounters which typify the difficulties in communication that often arise in parent-teacher interviews. 1. The Major by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Brian Victory. Parents: Julie Dawson, Leslie Dayman. - 2. Doctor Lawyer Indian Chief by Brian Bergin. Teacher: Julie Hamilton. Parents: Di Chamerlain, Alan Becher. - 3. A Stranger by Brian Bergin. Teacher: Paul Weingott. Parents: Carol Skinner, Ian Gray. - 4. A Matter of Motivation by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Colin Myers. Parents: Christine Martin-Murphy, Patrick Frost. - 5. Dear Miss Stevens by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Noni Hazelhurst. Mother: Mary Taylor.

results.title: Pardonnez moi, Mr. Karsh
results.brief_description: The photographer emerges, literally from the street and then, camera at the ready, makes Montreal his studio and the people in the street his subjects. He turns enquiring reporter and provokes scenes that are often fresh, lively and amusing when he asks “Do you think you are normal?”
results.description: The photographer emerges, literally from the street and then, camera at the ready, makes Montreal his studio and the people in the street his subjects. He turns enquiring reporter and provokes scenes that are often fresh, lively and amusing when he asks “Do you think you are normal?”

results.title: Parasitism, Parasitic Flatworms
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description: Traces the development of parasitic flatworms. Shows blood, lung and liver flukes and tapeworms. Defines predation, mutualism, internal and external parasitism and illustrates each of these patterns of behaviour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork

results.title: Paranoid schizophrenic
results.creator_credit: National Association of Mental Health and Robert Anderson
results.brief_description: The case history of a paranoid- schizophrenic, who believes that doctors, patients and the whole world are united in plotting his destruction. Dr Henry Dubost discusses the patient’s symptoms, treatment, and rehabilitation to his former job.

results.title: Paranoid
results.brief_description: Year nine students Dexy and Sam are already auteurs in the suburban shlock/horror genre. In this thilling chase through the streets of Melbourne city our unsuspecting hero realises that a mysterious and terrifying figure is following him.
results.description: Year nine students Dexy and Sam are already auteurs in the suburban shlock/horror genre. In this thilling chase through the streets of Melbourne city our unsuspecting hero realises that a mysterious and terrifying figure is following him.

holdings.name: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode

results.title: Paramount news
results.brief_description: Paramount news. 1. Cherry Blossoms - Korean. Washington DC, cheery blossoms are in bloom. Soldiers making faces, slanty-eyed and miming shooting. 2. Normandy Battle Front: Bombing by night on Caan movement of tanks. East of Caan. Infantry scenes of shooting in towns. Prisoner taken Cherbourg Sector. Churchill in Normandy. 3. Floods: Midwest USA. Sandbagging crews: Mississippi and Missouri Rivers reach their peaks. Tulsa, Oklahoma people moving evacuees. 4. How many wives polygamy in Utah. Fundamentalist Mormons challenge State laws. 5. Canada: Ski thriller - Course at Saint Marguerite. Womens downhill. 6.Tito partisans train in Malta. Yugoslav patriots including women camp erected. 7. China: Rice bowl battle. Narrated by Albert Martyn. Chinese army trying to capture Chang Ton from the Japanese. They retake it. Troops marching through streets. Mission Negri. British, Russian, US and Free France sample captured Japanese coffee and soldiers. 140 000 reduced to 50 000 after Japanese came. 8. B-17 Burns on Grounds. In England routine bombing mission. Fire breaks out. Explosions.
